titles.title: Providing for consideration of the bill (H.R. 538) to facilitate the development of energy on Indian lands by reducing Federal regulations that impede tribal development of Indian lands, and for other purposes, and providing for consideration of the bill (H.R. 702) to adapt to changing crude oil market conditions.

Providing for consideration of the bill (H.R. 538) to facilitate the development of energy on Indian lands by reducing Federal regulations that impede tribal development of Indian lands, and for other purposes, and providing for consideration of the bill (H.R. 702) to adapt to changing crude oil market conditions.

action.text: The House Committee on Rules reported an original measure, H. Rept. 114-290, by Mr. Byrne.

For H.R. 538, resolution provides for one hour of debate, makes specified amendments in order and allows one motion to recommit, with or without instructions. For H.R. 702, resolution provides for one hour of debate, makes specified amendments in order and allows one motion to recommit, with or without instructions.

calendar.text: Placed on the House Calendar, Calendar No. 65.

action.text: DEBATE - The House proceeded with one hour of debate on H. Res. 466.
On ordering the previous question Agreed to by the Yeas and Nays: 244 - 183 (Roll no. 541).

vote.text: On agreeing to the resolution Agreed to by recorded vote: 244 - 185 (Roll no. 542).

action.text: Motion to reconsider laid on the table Agreed to without objection.

bill.summary: Sets forth the rule for consideration of the bill (H.R. 538) to facilitate the development of energy on Indian lands by reducing Federal regulations that impede tribal development of Indian lands, and for other purposes, and providing for consideration of the bill (H.R. 702) to adapt to changing crude oil market conditions.
